title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 14-9.11 - Muffler on safety valve or safety relief valve
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 14-9.11 - Muffler on safety valve or safety relief valve

State Regulations
(a) If a muffler is used on a safety valve or
safety relief valve it shall have sufficient outlet area to prevent back
pressure from interfering with the proper operation and discharge capacity of
the valve. The muffler plates or other devices shall be so constructed as to
avoid any possibility of restriction of the steam passages due to
deposit. (b) Mufflers shall not be
used on high-temperature water boiler safety relief valves. (c) When a safety valve or safety relief
valve is exposed to outdoor elements which may affect operation of the valve, it is permissible to shield the valve with a satisfactory cover. The shield or
cover shall be properly vented and arranged to permit servicing and normal
operation of the valve. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
14-9.11

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
